objects.comment:
/**
* Asset is the base class for graphical assets.
* Assets are used with {@link Scene}, {@link Entity} etc.
* They are loaded as a HTML element 'img' tag.
*/
objects.classdesc:
Asset is the base class for graphical assets.
Assets are used with {@link Scene}, {@link Entity} etc. 
They are loaded as a HTML element 'img' tag.
objects.name: Asset

objects.description: Create a new Asset with the specified options

params.description: The options object for the Asset - see below
params.name: options

objects.name: Asset
Asset
objects.description: Create a new Asset with the specified options
objects.classdesc:
Asset is the base class for graphical assets.
Assets are used with {@link Scene}, {@link Entity} etc. 
They are loaded as a HTML element 'img' tag.

params.description: The options object for the Asset - see below
params.name: options

objects.description: Load the Asset asynchronously from its src and optionally trigger the supplied callback when available.

params.description: The callback function to invoke when the asset has been loaded
params.name: callback

objects.name: load

objects.classdesc: Audio is the base class for game audio, loaded into a HTML5 'audio' tag.
objects.name: Audio

objects.description: Create a new Audio with the specified options.

params.description: The options object for the Asset - see below
params.name: options

objects.name: Audio
Audio
objects.description: Create a new Audio with the specified options.
objects.classdesc: Audio is the base class for game audio, loaded into a HTML5 'audio' tag.

params.description: The options object for the Asset - see below
params.name: options

objects.description: Load the Audio asynchronously from its src and optionally trigger the supplied callback when available.

params.description: The callback function to invoke when the asset has been loaded
params.name: callback

objects.name: load

objects.description: Play the audio from the current position.
objects.name: play

objects.comment:
/**
* Play the audio from the start time index to the end time index and optionally loop.
* @param {float} start The start offset in ms (optional)
* @param {float} end The end offset in ms (optional)
* @param {boolean} start Loop the audio (optional)
*/
objects.description: Play the audio from the start time index to the end time index and optionally loop.

params.description: The start offset in ms (optional)
params.name: start

params.description: The end offset in ms (optional)
params.name: end

params.description: Loop the audio (optional)
params.name: start

objects.name: playRange

objects.description: Pause the audio at the current position.
objects.name: pause

objects.description: Stop the audio and reset it to the beginning
objects.name: stop

objects.comment:
/**
* Fade out the audio over the given duration then call the optional callback
* @param {integer} duration Fade duration in ms
* @param {function} callback The callback function to invoke when the fade has completed
*/
objects.description: Fade out the audio over the given duration then call the optional callback

params.description: Fade duration in ms
params.name: duration

params.description: The callback function to invoke when the fade has completed
params.name: callback

objects.name: fadeOut

objects.comment:
/**
* Fade in the audio over the given duration then call the optional callback
* @param {integer} duration Fade duration in ms
* @param {function} callback The callback function to invoke when the fade has completed
*/
objects.description: Fade in the audio over the given duration then call the optional callback

params.description: Fade duration in ms
params.name: duration

params.description: The callback function to invoke when the fade has completed
params.name: callback

objects.name: fadeIn

objects.classdesc: BackgroundScene is the base class for static backgrounds.
examples:
<caption>Create a new BackgroundScene from an {@link Asset}</caption>
var mainMapBackgroundAsset = new Asset({ name: 'mainMapBackgroundAsset', src: 'assets/mainmap_background.png' })
var scene = new BackgroundScene({ asset: mainMapBackgroundAsset, x: 0, y: 0 })
objects.name: BackgroundScene

objects.comment:
/**
* Create a new BackgroundScene with the specified options.
* @param {object} options The options for the BackgroundScene, composed of the properties.
* @property {integer} offsetX The offset x-coordinate in the asset in pixels (optional, default 0)
* @property {integer} offsetY The offset y-coordinate in the asset in pixels (optional, default 0)
* @property {integer} width The width in pixels (optional, default asset width)
* @property {integer} height The height in pixels (optional, default asset height)
*/
objects.description: Create a new BackgroundScene with the specified options.

params.description: The options for the BackgroundScene, composed of the properties.
params.name: options

properties.description: The offset x-coordinate in the asset in pixels (optional, default 0)
properties.name: offsetX

properties.description: The offset y-coordinate in the asset in pixels (optional, default 0)
properties.name: offsetY

properties.description: The width in pixels (optional, default asset width)
properties.name: width

properties.description: The height in pixels (optional, default asset height)
properties.name: height

objects.name: BackgroundScene

objects.comment:
/**
* Create a new BackgroundScene with the specified options.
* @param {object} options The options for the BackgroundScene, composed of the properties.
* @property {integer} offsetX The offset x-coordinate in the asset in pixels (optional, default 0)
* @property {integer} offsetY The offset y-coordinate in the asset in pixels (optional, default 0)
* @property {integer} width The width in pixels (optional, default asset width)
* @property {integer} height The height in pixels (optional, default asset height)
*/
objects.name: BackgroundScene
objects.description: Create a new BackgroundScene with the specified options.
objects.classdesc: BackgroundScene is the base class for static backgrounds.

var scene = new BackgroundScene({ asset: mainMapBackgroundAsset, x: 0, y: 0 })

objects.comment:
/**
* Entity is the base class for subgraphics.
* @mixes HasEntitiesMixin
*/
objects.classdesc: Entity is the base class for subgraphics.
objects.name: Entity

objects.comment:
/**
* Create a new Entity with the specified options
* @param {Object} options The options for the Entity, composed of the properties.
* @property {Asset} asset The {@link Asset} to use for the Entity tiles
* @property {Object} parent The parent of this Entity
* @property {integer} x The x-coordinate in pixels relative to its parent (optional, default 0)
* @property {integer} y The y-coordinate in pixels relative to its parent (optional, default 0)
* @property {integer} z The z-coordinate relative to its parent (optional, default 0)
* @property {float} scale The current scale (zoom) where 1 = 100% (optional, default 1)
* @property {float} rotate The current rotation where 0ยบ (optional, default 0)
* @property {boolean} visible Set if this Entity is visible (optional, default true)
*/
objects.description: Create a new Entity with the specified options

params.description: The options for the Entity, composed of the properties.
params.name: options

properties.description: The {@link Asset} to use for the Entity tiles
properties.name: asset

properties.description: The parent of this Entity
properties.name: parent

properties.description: The x-coordinate in pixels relative to its parent (optional, default 0)
properties.name: x

properties.description: The y-coordinate in pixels relative to its parent (optional, default 0)
properties.name: y

properties.description: The z-coordinate relative to its parent (optional, default 0)
properties.name: z

properties.description: The current scale (zoom) where 1 = 100% (optional, default 1)
properties.name: scale

properties.description: The current rotation where 0ยบ (optional, default 0)
properties.name: rotate

properties.description: Set if this Entity is visible (optional, default true)
properties.name: visible

objects.name: Entity

* @property {integer} y The y-coordinate in pixels relative to its parent (optional, default 0)

* @property {float} scale The current scale (zoom) where 1 = 100% (optional, default 1)

* @property {boolean} visible Set if this Entity is visible (optional, default true)
*/

objects.comment: // Stop with an optional Stop Status
objects.name: animateStop

objects.comment:
/**
*  The animation stopped because it was finished (non-looped) or a boundary condition was met (maxX, maxY)
* @constant
*/
objects.description: The animation stopped because it was finished (non-looped) or a boundary condition was met (maxX, maxY)
objects.name: STOPSTATUS_COMPLETED

objects.comment:
/**
* The animation was stopped with animateStop
* @constant
*/
objects.description: The animation was stopped with animateStop
objects.name: STOPSTATUS_STOPPED

objects.comment:
/**
* The animation was stopped because animateStart was called with a new animation, replacing it
* @constant
*/
objects.description: The animation was stopped because animateStart was called with a new animation, replacing it
objects.name: STOPSTATUS_REPLACED

objects.comment:
/**
*  GameEngine is the base class for the top level container, mapping the game into a browser.
*  You should extend GameEngine to implement your own game.
*/
objects.classdesc:
GameEngine is the base class for the top level container, mapping the game into a browser.
 You should extend GameEngine to implement your own game.
objects.name: GameEngine

objects.comment:
/** * Create a new GameEngine with the specified options. * @param {object} options The options for the GameEngine, composed of the properties. * @property {!string} targetId The DOM id of the element to target. This element will be replaced with a HTML5 'canvas' element. * @property {boolean} fullscreen Allow the canvas element to occupy the maximum possible space (optional, default false) * @property {boolean} showHUD Show the debug Heads Up Display (HUD) (optional, default false) * @property {integer} x The viewport x-coordinate in pixels (optional, default 0) * @property {integer} y The viewport y-coordinate in pixels (optional, default 0) * @property {float} scale The current scale (zoom) where 1 = 100% (optional, default 1) * @property {integer} minX The minimum viewport x-coordinate in pixels (optional) * @property {integer} minY The minimum viewport y-coordinate in pixels (optional) * @property {integer} maxX The maximum viewport x-coordinate in pixels (optional) * @property {integer} maxY The maximum viewport y-coordinate in pixels (optional) * @property {float} globalAlpha The global alpha value (0 to 1) for drawing scenes (optional, default 1) * @property {boolean} enableScroll Enable mouse scrolling (optional, default true) * @property {boolean} enableZoom Enable mouse zooming (optional, default true) * @property {integer} width The width of the viewport in pixels (readonly) * @property {integer} height The height of the viewport in pixels (readonly) * @mixes HasScenesMixin * @mixes HasEntitiesMixin * @example To create a GameEngine attached to a specified element in HTML5
*/
objects.description: Create a new GameEngine with the specified options.

params.description: The options for the GameEngine, composed of the properties.
params.name: options

properties.description: The DOM id of the element to target. This element will be replaced with a HTML5 'canvas' element.
properties.name: targetId

properties.description: Allow the canvas element to occupy the maximum possible space (optional, default false)
properties.name: fullscreen

properties.description: Show the debug Heads Up Display (HUD)  (optional, default false)
properties.name: showHUD

properties.description: The viewport x-coordinate in pixels (optional, default 0)
properties.name: x

properties.description: The viewport y-coordinate in pixels (optional, default 0)
properties.name: y

properties.description: The current scale (zoom) where 1 = 100% (optional, default 1)
properties.name: scale

properties.description: The minimum viewport x-coordinate in pixels (optional)
properties.name: minX

properties.description: The minimum viewport y-coordinate in pixels (optional)
properties.name: minY

properties.description: The maximum viewport x-coordinate in pixels (optional)
properties.name: maxX

properties.description: The maximum viewport y-coordinate in pixels (optional)
properties.name: maxY

properties.description: The global alpha value (0 to 1) for drawing scenes (optional, default 1)
properties.name: globalAlpha

properties.description: Enable mouse scrolling (optional, default true)
properties.name: enableScroll

properties.description: Enable mouse zooming (optional, default true)
properties.name: enableZoom

properties.description: The width of the viewport in pixels (readonly)
properties.name: width

properties.description: The height of the viewport in pixels (readonly)
properties.name: height

examples: To create a GameEngine attached to a specified element in HTML5
objects.name: GameEngine

objects.comment:
/** * Create a new GameEngine with the specified options. * @param {object} options The options for the GameEngine, composed of the properties. * @property {!string} targetId The DOM id of the element to target. This element will be replaced with a HTML5 'canvas' element. * @property {boolean} fullscreen Allow the canvas element to occupy the maximum possible space (optional, default false) * @property {boolean} showHUD Show the debug Heads Up Display (HUD) (optional, default false) * @property {integer} x The viewport x-coordinate in pixels (optional, default 0) * @property {integer} y The viewport y-coordinate in pixels (optional, default 0) * @property {float} scale The current scale (zoom) where 1 = 100% (optional, default 1) * @property {integer} minX The minimum viewport x-coordinate in pixels (optional) * @property {integer} minY The minimum viewport y-coordinate in pixels (optional) * @property {integer} maxX The maximum viewport x-coordinate in pixels (optional) * @property {integer} maxY The maximum viewport y-coordinate in pixels (optional) * @property {float} globalAlpha The global alpha value (0 to 1) for drawing scenes (optional, default 1) * @property {boolean} enableScroll Enable mouse scrolling (optional, default true) * @property {boolean} enableZoom Enable mouse zooming (optional, default true) * @property {integer} width The width of the viewport in pixels (readonly) * @property {integer} height The height of the viewport in pixels (readonly) * @mixes HasScenesMixin * @mixes HasEntitiesMixin * @example To create a GameEngine attached to a specified element in HTML5
*/
objects.name: GameEngine
objects.description: Create a new GameEngine with the specified options.
examples: To create a GameEngine attached to a specified element in HTML5
objects.classdesc:
GameEngine is the base class for the top level container, mapping the game into a browser.
 You should extend GameEngine to implement your own game.

params.description: The options for the GameEngine, composed of the properties.
params.name: options

properties.description: The DOM id of the element to target. This element will be replaced with a HTML5 'canvas' element.
properties.name: targetId

properties.description: Allow the canvas element to occupy the maximum possible space (optional, default false)
properties.name: fullscreen

properties.description: Show the debug Heads Up Display (HUD)  (optional, default false)
properties.name: showHUD

properties.description: The viewport x-coordinate in pixels (optional, default 0)
properties.name: x

properties.description: The viewport y-coordinate in pixels (optional, default 0)
properties.name: y

properties.description: The current scale (zoom) where 1 = 100% (optional, default 1)
properties.name: scale

properties.description: The minimum viewport x-coordinate in pixels (optional)
properties.name: minX

properties.description: The minimum viewport y-coordinate in pixels (optional)
properties.name: minY

properties.description: The maximum viewport x-coordinate in pixels (optional)
properties.name: maxX

properties.description: The maximum viewport y-coordinate in pixels (optional)
properties.name: maxY

properties.description: The global alpha value (0 to 1) for drawing scenes (optional, default 1)
properties.name: globalAlpha

properties.description: Enable mouse scrolling (optional, default true)
properties.name: enableScroll

properties.description: Enable mouse zooming (optional, default true)
properties.name: enableZoom

properties.description: The width of the viewport in pixels (readonly)
properties.name: width

properties.description: The height of the viewport in pixels (readonly)
properties.name: height

objects.comment:
/**
* Start the game, loading all {@link Asset}s and {@link Audio}s defined by [addAsset()]{@link GameEngine#addAsset} and [addAudio()]{@link GameEngine#addAudio}, bind to the HTML element, call [init()]{@link GameEngine#init} and start the renderer.
*
* @param {function} callback The callback function to invoke when the game has been started (optional)
*/
objects.description: Start the game, loading all {@link Asset}s and {@link Audio}s defined by [addAsset()]{@link GameEngine#addAsset} and [addAudio()]{@link GameEngine#addAudio}, bind to the HTML element, call [init()]{@link GameEngine#init} and start the renderer.

params.description: The callback function to invoke when the game has been started (optional)
params.name: callback

objects.name: start

objects.comment:
/**
* Init is called after asset and audio loading. You should override init to create your Scenes, Entities and other game objects.
*
* Note: If you override init, you *must* call the callback when done.
* @param {function} callback The callback function to invoke when the init has been completed
*/
objects.description:
Init is called after asset and audio loading. You should override init to create your Scenes, Entities and other game objects.

Note: If you override init, you *must* call the callback when done.

params.description: The callback function to invoke when the init has been completed
params.name: callback

objects.name: init

objects.comment:
/**
* Add an asset definition. Note that the {@link Asset} resource will not be created until [start()]{@link GameEngine#start} is called.
* @param {String} name Asset Name
* @param {String} src Source filename
*/
objects.description: Add an asset definition. Note that the {@link Asset} resource will not be created until [start()]{@link GameEngine#start} is called.

params.description: Asset Name
params.name: name

params.description: Source filename
params.name: src

objects.name: addAsset

objects.comment:
/**
* Get the {@link Asset} with the specified name.
* @param {String} name Asset Name
* @returns {Asset} The Asset with the specified name, or null
* @throws {Exception} Will throw 'Asset not found' if the Asset has not been loaded
*/
objects.description: Get the {@link Asset} with the specified name.

params.description: Asset Name
params.name: name

returns.description: The Asset with the specified name, or null

exceptions.description: Will throw 'Asset not found' if the Asset has not been loaded

objects.name: getAsset

*/
objects.description: Add an audio definition. Note that the {@link Audio} resource will not be created until [start()]{@link GameEngine#start} is called.

returns.description: The Audio with the specified name, or null

exceptions.description: Will throw 'Audio not found' if the Audio has not been loaded

objects.name: getScenesAtLayer

objects.description: Recalculate the draw order of all scenes based on their Z coordinate and store internally, for use by [drawScenes()]{@link HasScenes#drawScenes}) and [getScenesAtLayer()]{@link HasScenes#getScenesAtLayer})
objects.name: sortScenesZ

objects.description: Call redraw on all scenes in this container by calling [redraw()]{@link Scene#redraw}
objects.name: redrawScenes

objects.classdesc:
Mixin contains functions for creating mixins - a way to do multiple inheritance in JavaScript.
Mixin classes can be defined, and their functionality merged into an instance of another class
when it is instantiated.
examples:
<caption>To define a Mixin class</caption>
const { Mixin } = require('tenkai')

class YourMixinClass extends Mixin {
	static init(obj, options) {
		// Do your initialisation here, like you would in a constructor.
		// obj is the new object, eqivalent of 'this'.
		// The user class can pass options, etc.
		obj.testValue = 'This is a Mixin Class' 
	}

	// Add methods as per a standard class:
	mixinMethod() {
		...
		console.log('mixinMethod: '+this.testValue)
		...
	}
}

// Use the Mixin.export() function to export the class.
module.exports = Mixin.export(YourMixinClass)

<caption>To use a Mixin class</caption>
const YourMixinClass = require('./YourMixinClass')

class YourMixinUserClass {
	constructor(options = {}) {

		// Call the mixin with this and any options
		YourMixinClass(this, options)
	}

	anotherMethod() {
		// Now you can use the properties and methods on the mixin

		console.log(this.testValue)
		this.mixinMethod()
	}
}
objects.name: Mixin

objects.comment:
/**
* Use export to export the class from the module as a mixin.
* @param {Class} klass The class to export as a mixin
* @example
* module.exports = Mixin.export(YourMixinClass)
*/
objects.description: Use export to export the class from the module as a mixin.

params.description: The class to export as a mixin
params.name: klass

objects.name: export

objects.comment:
/**
* Scene is the base class for scenes, which can contain child Scenes, {@link Entity}s, and {@link Props}
*
* @mixes HasScenesMixin
* @mixes HasEntitiesMixin
* @abstract
*/
objects.classdesc: Scene is the base class for scenes, which can contain child Scenes, {@link Entity}s, and {@link Props}
objects.name: Scene

objects.comment:
/**
* Create a new Scene with the specified options.
* @param {object} options The options for the GameEngine, composed of the properties.
* @property {Asset} asset The {@link Asset} to use for the Scene tiles
* @property {Object} parent The parent of this Scene
* @property {integer} x The x-coordinate in pixels relative to its parent (optional, default 0)
* @property {integer} y The y-coordinate in pixels relative to its parent (optional, default 0)
* @property {integer} z The z-coordinate relative to its parent (optional, default 0)
* @property {float} scale The current scale (zoom) where 1 = 100% (optional, default 1)
* @property {boolean} visible Set if this Scene is visible (optional, default true)
* @property {boolean} enableScroll Enable mouse scrolling (optional, default true)
*/
objects.description: Create a new Scene with the specified options.

params.description: The options for the GameEngine, composed of the properties.
params.name: options

properties.description: The {@link Asset} to use for the Scene tiles
properties.name: asset

properties.description: The parent of this Scene
properties.name: parent

properties.description: The x-coordinate in pixels relative to its parent (optional, default 0)
properties.name: x

properties.description: The y-coordinate in pixels relative to its parent (optional, default 0)
properties.name: y

properties.description: The z-coordinate relative to its parent (optional, default 0)
properties.name: z

properties.description: The current scale (zoom) where 1 = 100% (optional, default 1)
properties.name: scale

properties.description: Set if this Scene is visible (optional, default true)
properties.name: visible

properties.description: Enable mouse scrolling (optional, default true)
properties.name: enableScroll

objects.classdesc: TiledScene is the base class for tiled backgrounds.
examples:
<caption>Create a new TiledScene with 16x16 tiles from an {@link Asset}</caption>
var mainMapTilesAsset = new Asset({ name: 'mainMapTilesAsset', src: 'assets/mainmap_tileset.png' })
var scene = new TiledScene({ asset: mainMapTilesAsset, tileWidth: 16, tileHeight: 16, x: 0, y: 0 })
objects.name: TiledScene

objects.comment:
/**
* Create a new TiledScene with the specified options.
* @param {object} options The options for the TiledScene, composed of the properties.
* @property {integer} tileWidth The width of each tile in the asset
* @property {integer} tileHeight The height of each tile in the asset
* @property {integer} perspectiveMode The perspective mode of this TiledScene
*/
objects.description: Create a new TiledScene with the specified options.

params.description: The options for the TiledScene, composed of the properties.
params.name: options

properties.description: The width of each tile in the asset
properties.name: tileWidth

properties.description: The height of each tile in the asset
properties.name: tileHeight

properties.description: The perspective mode of this TiledScene
properties.name: perspectiveMode
